lines.text:
[remembering Lisa fondly as he looks at her picture]
Ah, little Lisa. Why did you ever let her go?

[discussing Lisa]
She told Jacques you didn't need her any more. He offered to take her on, but she never got back to him. He told me that she said she wanted her pay donated to one of those missions downtown, in Skid Row.
[looks at Lisa's photo]
Ah, she was special. Wasn't she? Or did I miss something?

[deeply regretful]
No, Marty. You didn't miss anything. I think I did.

[showing his photos of the Homeless]
I think this is my best work.

[mockingly]
Your best work?

[angry]
Yes!

[sarcastically]
Oh, really? Your best work I think was the "Homeless Avocado" we shot a little while back. That was your best work!

[has fallen in love watching Lisa dance gracefully]
You've really got a gift, girl.

[blushing]
I wasn't that good. I'm really out of shape.
You could've fooled me. This is serious talent here. You should do something with it.
Maybe I will.
[pause]
Someday.

[softly]
You will.

[fearful that Lisa is leaving to return to the streets]
What's going on? What are you doing? It's crazy to go back there!

[desperately trying to convince Lisa to stay]
Listen! Don't move! I want to talk to you about staying here and working for me.
[shouting]
I can pay you!

[angry and frustrated at another fashion photo shoot]
I'm doing it again. Damn you, Marty! I don't believe it! More freaking underwear!

[very softly]
It's good to help your friend.

[caught by surprise as Lisa speaks for the first time]
What? You said something.
